abstract.p: Howard Goldberg reviews dry rose wines from Navarra, Spain; photo (M)

block.p: CHOICE dry roses, as light as summer's air currents, are garden parties in a bottle. Their watercolor palettes -- pink, cherry, coral, salmon -- and delicate flavors lift the spirit and tickle the appetite. Today, the breed, defamed by white zinfandel, is being redeemed by Spanish rosado.

Navarra, in the north, has become synonymous with stylish rosado, like the '99 Vega Sindoa from Bodegas Nekeas. A sweet bouquet yields to a dry, tangy collage of miniaturized fruity flavors. Pour the wine with chicken, veal, ham and salmon.

CHOICE dry roses, as light as summer's air currents, are garden parties in a bottle. Their watercolor palettes -- pink, cherry, coral, salmon -- and delicate flavors lift the spirit and tickle the appetite. Today, the breed, defamed by white zinfandel, is being redeemed by Spanish rosado.

Navarra, in the north, has become synonymous with stylish rosado, like the '99 Vega Sindoa from Bodegas Nekeas. A sweet bouquet yields to a dry, tangy collage of miniaturized fruity flavors. Pour the wine with chicken, veal, ham and salmon.
It costs $7 at Outlet Wines, 195 North Bedford Road, Mount Kisco. Commuters can find it for $8 at Grande Harvest, opposite Track 17 in Grand Central Terminal.

Francophiles may relish the coral-pink '99 Chateau Routas Rouviere rose, an almost austere grenache-syrah-cinsault blend, which alluringly whispers the Provencal accents of its obscure Coteaux Varois appellation.
It costs $8 at Vaccaro's, 124 Midland Avenue (Pathmark shopping center), Port Chester, and $7 at Arlington Wine and Liquor, 718 Dutchess Turnpike (Arlington Square shopping center), Poughkeepsie.

The '99 Wolffer rose from the fashionable Sagpond Vineyards in Sagaponack on the South Fork of Long Island -- a wine and estate that are darlings of the Gold Coast -- is not yet sold in Westchester. But Sagpond can deliver it locally within days. This Tavel-like ($10) rose, a tailgate-picnic favorite at the Hamptons Classic horse show, is born to accompany Proust at poolside.
Drink these wines young; if you ice them long, it's vinicide. Pour them marginally cool or near-warm, swish them aerobically in your mouth for 45 seconds and watch them blossom.
